required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Metastatic Tumors of the Urogenital Area With Cytokine-induced Killer Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Metastatic Tumors of the Urogenital Area (Bladder Cancer, Renal Cancel) With Cytokine-induced Killer Cells

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

clinical_study.source: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

brief_summary.textblock: Treatment of metastatic tumors of the urogenital area with cytokine-induced killer cells

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical efficacy evaluation as measured by 1 year relapse free survival
primary_outcome.description: The 1 year relapse free survival will be used as a measure for the clinical efficacy of the cytokine-induced killer cells in the treatment of malignant tumors of urogenital area

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and treatment tolerance of the cytokine-induced killer cells
primary_outcome.description: Safety of the cytokine-induced killer cells application, which include determination of adverse effects associated with the therapy. Blood tests, renal and liver function will be studied.

arm_group.description: Patients with the metastatic tumors of the urogenital area receiving standard treatment and autologous cytokine-induced killer cells
Patients with metastatic tumors of the urogenital area receiving standard treatment

intervention.description: Autologous cytokine-induced killer cells injected intravenously

intervention.intervention_name: Standard treatment according to the Clinical protocols
intervention.description: Standard treatment of bladder/renal cancer according to the Clinical protocols

overall_official.affiliation: the Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

facility.name: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus
